I tried your both options with or without quotes, but still the same 
problem except it gives me different error message by putting the 
quotes around the directory ;-)

Error Message:
C:\>java junit.awtui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: 
junit/awtui/TestRunner

Thanks :-)


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "George Thomas" <pgeorge@a...> wrote:
> Hi there,
> >I am receiving a message called "Class not found" after running ..
> ...<snip>...
> >I also made sure that my CLASSPATH is set properly as:
> >CLASSPATH=c:\Program Files\junit3.8.1\junit.jar
> 
> I believe the space in the directory name could be the issue. You 
could do
> two things
> 1) Try placing quotes around the directory like so
> CLASSPATH="c:\Program Files\junit3.8.1\junit.jar"
> 
> or do it my preferred way ;-)
> 2) Install junit into it's own folder under root like so :-
> CLASSPATH="c:\junit\junit3.8.1\junit.jar"
> 
> Hope this helps
> 
> regards George
